title: Annoying message
body:
Docker private blockchain started like

```
docker run --name=bc-beacon-01 --hostname=bc-beacon-01 \
--network=internal \
-v $(pwd)/node01/consensus:/consensus \
-v $(pwd)/node01/secret:/secret \
-v /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime:ro \
-d gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:HEAD-58df1f1 \
--datadir /consensus/beacondata \
--min-sync-peers=0 \
--genesis-state=/consensus/genesis.ssz \
--chain-config-file=/consensus/config.yml \
--chain-id=8658 \
--rpc-host=0.0.0.0 \
--monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 \
--contract-deployment-block=0 \
--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0 \
--execution-endpoint=http://bc-node01:8551 \
--accept-terms-of-use \
--jwt-secret=/secret/jwtsecret \
--suggested-fee-recipient=0x48deeb***9af454ec4*******6e50**6e19e \
--disable-staking-contract-check \
--no-discovery \
--bootstrap-node= 
```
prysm v4.0.7 (linux amd64)

Geth v1.12.2-stable-bed84606/linux-amd64/go1.20.7


```
time="2023-08-18 03:06:16" level=error msg="Failed to find peers" error="failed to find peers for subnet" prefix=p2p

```

@icemagno This issue is better opened here:
https://github.com/OffchainLabs/eth-pos-devnet

Also if you are trying to run a node, its better to use the flags described in the devnet steps:
https://github.com/OffchainLabs/eth-pos-devnet/blob/master/docker-compose.yml

Would be cool if someone tell us why to use each one of these flags. 

Blind follow / copy and paste is not much for learning.

The official docs are not clear
Ok... seems I've done something wrong. All is fine now.
